isValid

public static final boolean isValid(Envelope e)
Determines if the given Envelope is valid.

Parameters:
e - the envelope
Returns:
True if non-null and has non-zero width and height, else False

isEmpty

public static final boolean isEmpty(Geometry g)
Determines if the given Geometry is empty. This method returns True for linear and point shapes, and False for polygons and envelopes if they are "collapsed".

Parameters:
g - the geometry
Returns:
True if the Geometry is empty, else False

parseEnvelope

public static final Envelope parseEnvelope(Envelope e,
                                           String s)
                                    throws InvalidValuesException,
                                           ParseException
Parses a String containing 4 double precision values that are seperated by blank (for example, "0.0 0.0 8.0 7.0"), and returns the resulting Envelope.

Parameters:
e - optional Envelope to receive the result, if e==null then a new Envelope is created
s - the string to be parsed
Returns:
the resulting envelope
Throws:
InvalidValuesException - if there is more than 4 values
ParseException - if any value is invalid

parseEnvelope

public static final Envelope parseEnvelope(Envelope e,
                                           String s,
                                           String sep)
                                    throws InvalidValuesException,
                                           ParseException
Parses a String containing 4 double precision values that are seperated by given separator and return the resulting Envelope.

Parameters:
e - optional Envelope to receive the result, if e==null then a new Envelope is created
s - the string to be parsed
sep - the separator in the passing in string of 's'
Returns:
the resulting envelope
Throws:
InvalidValuesException - if there is more than 4 values
ParseException - if any value is invalid

Calculates the Envelope of the given set of points.

Parameters:
e - the optional Envelope to receive the result, if e==null then a new Envelope is created
points - the array of Points for which an Envelope will be calculated
Returns:
the resulting Envelope

calcEnvelope

                                          double[] X,
                                          double[] Y)
Calculates the Envelope of the given set of points.

Parameters:
e - the optional Envelope to receive the result, if e==null then a new Envelope is created
X - the array of X ordinates
Y - the array of Y ordinates
Returns:
the resulting Envelope

calcArea

public static final double calcArea(Point[] points)
Calculates the vector area of the given collection of points. Vector area is a signed scalar value. The absolute value is equal to the area of the point collection. Its value is positive if the points are anti-clockwise, and negative if clockwise. This method assumes that point[0] == points[points.length-1]

Parameters:
points - the array of points
Returns:
the vector area

calcArea

public static final double calcArea(double[] x,
                                    double[] y)
Calculates the vector area of a collection of points. Vector area is a signed scalar value. The absolute value is equal to the area of the point collection. Its value is positive if the points are anti-clockwise, and negative if clockwise. This method assumes that the first and last values of the arrays are equal, x[0]==x[n-1] and y[0]==y[n-1]

Parameters:
x - the array of X ordinates
y - the array of Y ordinates
Returns:
the vector area

isClockwise

public static final boolean isClockwise(Point[] points)
Determines if the perimeter of an area represented by the given point array, follows a clockwise or anti-clockwise order. This method is a thin wrapper for the calcArea method.

Returns:
a boolean value - True if clockwise, False otherwise
See Also:
calcArea(com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Point[])

isClockwise

public static final boolean isClockwise(double[] x,
                                        double[] y)
Determines if the perimeter of an area represented by the given arrays follow a clockwise or anti-clockwise order.

Returns:
True if clockwise, else False
See Also:
calcArea(com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Point[])

setAspect

public static Envelope setAspect(Envelope e,
                                 Dimension d)
Adjusts the world coordinates Envelope to have the same aspect ratio as the given pixel area dimension.

Parameters:
e - the world coordinates Envelope to be adjusted
d - the pixel area dimensions
Returns:
a new Envelope containing the adjusted coordinates
